definition: Turkestan

sentences.english: The development course of Pan-Turkism has been traced in the thesis.
sentences.chinese: 追溯了泛突厥主義發展的歷史。

sentences.english: The Turks destroyed, he was with the Yuezhi united.
sentences.chinese: 突厥被滅，原是他與月氏聯合。

sentences.english: The prime minister YuWenHuaJi in order to take the throne with collude with the turks.
sentences.chinese: 丞相宇文化及爲了奪取皇位同突厥暗中勾結。

sentences.english: The Tungans were stricter than the Turkish Muslims in their religious worship.
sentences.chinese: 回回在他們的宗教信仰上比突厥穆斯林更嚴格。

sentences.english: At length, they two leaded the procession and beated the Turki.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他們兩個帶領軍隊打敗了突厥。

sentences.english: The use of Uzbek language belongs to Altaic Turkic language branch, West Huns.
sentences.chinese: 使用烏孜別克語，屬阿爾泰語系突厥語族西匈奴語支。

sentences.english: Actually it was not only Chinese that caused Turks flee to west.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，並非僅僅是中國人導致突厥人西逃。

sentences.english: Seljuq Turks originated from the tribe of Oghuz.
sentences.chinese: 塞爾柱突厥人起源於突厥民族烏古斯部落。

sentences.english: Seljuq Turks originated from the tribe of Oghuz.
sentences.chinese: 塞爾柱突厥人起源於突厥民族烏古斯部落。

sentences.english: Buddhism believed by Turki is mainly introduced from China mainland.
sentences.chinese: 突厥語族羣所信仰的佛教主要是由內地傳入的。

sentences.english: The Turks themselves wanted it that way.
sentences.chinese: 突厥人自己也想別人這麼叫他們。

sentences.english: They are Russia's most populous Turkic peoples.
sentences.chinese: 他們是俄羅斯人口最多的突厥語民族。

sentences.english: Gu five personally to kill, destroy Turkic army.
sentences.chinese: 顧小五親自上陣殺敵，突厥全軍履滅。

sentences.english: The Uighurs are a Turkic-speaking Chinese Muslim minority.
sentences.chinese: 維吾爾人是講突厥語的中國回教徒少數民族。

sentences.english: The part of Peking where these Turkish Moslems live is called Chintusze.
sentences.chinese: 北京的這些突厥穆斯林居住的地區被稱作‘纏頭寺’。

sentences.english: They're descended from a failed invasion from the eastern Turkic empire.
sentences.chinese: 他們起源於一個說着東突厥語的帝國的失敗入侵。

definition: Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
khan (loanword)
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Qarluq or Karluk nomadic tribe, a Turkic ethnic minority in ancient times
Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
khanate (Mongol state)
Mongolia
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
